summary_comment: Professor Bomser is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching skills, making complex material accessible and engaging. Students appreciate his fun and humorous lecturing style, his caring and approachable demeanor, and the manageable workload with open-note exams and take-home labs. His dedication to student engagement and well-being is evident, making him a standout professor in the eyes of his students.

Ratings.comment: Genuinely my favorite class I've taken this semester. He teaches tricky material in a way that's super easy! He's also just a super fun lecturer. I think I'm going to try to take another one of his classes in college. 10/10 guy.

He is truly kind man that has a passion to teach. The class have easy online exams that you take on your own time and structured work that is super manageable. We had take home labs that weren't exactly my favorite, but it was connected to the material.

Such a good class and professor! Your grade only consists of 4 online exams open note and labs about every week. Almost every Friday class was moved online. He cares about his students and doesn't act like he's superior because he's the professor. Attendance is optional. Funny to listen to as well.

My favorite professor. 4 exams, last one is optional if you're ok with your grade of the first three. there are labs every week but they're pretty simple. Yeah, I just liked the class, he's really cool and funny. He really appreciates people showing up, even though attendance isn't mandatory, so please show up if you're taking his class.
My fav professor by far

I looked forward to Professor Bomser's lectures week to week and he genuinely made me care more about my nutrition. I never expected to like a class I took to fulfill a gened so much but Bomser made his lectures really engaging and interesting and he'd actually go into entertaining random tangents about his life. Highly recommend taking his class.
Fun lectures and all tests open note. Enjoyable class

Professor Bomser is not only engaged and interested in the material he teaches, but he goes above and beyond to display care for each and every student in his class. Even in a large lecture setting, I felt cared for and respected by him. He is understanding and down to earth, and truly unlike any professor I've had previously. Would recommend!!

Professor Bomser was a really great professor that was super will to work with me to get where I needed to be. Although lectures are not mandatory I recommend attending, I got a lot out of them and really enjoyed. One thing I would say is beware of the TAs they were big sticklers when grading labs. Overall great option for the natural science GE.

By far my favorite professor that I have had at OSU. The content is not always the easiest, but Dr. Bomser is incredible at explaining hard concepts. He genuinely cares about his students and is very personable. I cannot recommend him enough.

Prof. Bomser was an amazing guy and one of my favorite professors at OSU. He genuinely cares about the material and he is very accessible outside of class. He records and posts all lectures if you are unable to make it to class. He brought us all donuts one day and makes it known he appreciates us showing up to class. Tests are straightforward.
Silly guy. Class was overall very easy as long as you pay attention... if you do have any questions, he is happy to help & very easy to talk to. Made my semester a breeze.
I love Josh.

Super nice, caring professor. Posts lectures, online labs, and 4 exams (open note, your worst score exam gets dropped at end of semester). He loves to answer questions in class and values people's attendance. Very knowledgeable and funny. Easy class if you do your work
GOAT Prof BOMSER

Dr. Bomser is very chill and a good teacher.  Class isn't madatory and all lectures are posted online, but it's worth it to go in person.  He doesn't make you buy the textbook.  4 exams, 6 labs.  All labs are online and super easy.  Love this guy!

Dr. Bomser is the best professor I have ever had. He is caring, funny, accessible and he teaches the material in such a way that makes it fun and easy to understand. He is very clear on what you need to know. I genuinely wish I could take every class with him.
Very easy class, online exams that are open note open book and labs are online as well.

Professor Bomser is the best professor I have ever had at OSU.  I was excited to attend his lectures every morning.  We didn't need a textbook; everything we needed to know was covered in lecture.  Not only that, but all the lectures were recorded so we could go back and watch them whenever.  I am so grateful to have taken this class.

I loved professor Bomser! His lectures were really enjoyable and he always uploaded them online. There aren't too many assignments but if you pay attention you'll be fine. Overall, this was a great class and If I was a nutrition major I would definitely take him again.

One of my favorite professors! However, take your time studying and taking his exams as there are few assignments throughout the semester - but they are not difficult. Cares about his students in and outside the classroom. Always ready to answer any questions you have.
Not much outside of lectures (20-40 minutes). No required readings. Tests are closed book and a bit tricky. Interesting content though.

he is a great professor and very understanding. one of the few that genuinely wants you to succeed. lectures and classes are organized very well. only 2 very easy assignments and 4 exams, only 3 of the best counts. exams are straight out the lectures, no BS.

Prof. Bomser is truly one of my favorite professors at Ohio State so far. He is very clear with his content in his lectures, and very open to help if you are not understanding. The Human Nutrition 2210 course is 4 exams (1 dropped) and 2 assignments, with 3 lectures a week. It is organized very well and his positive attitude makes it even easier.

good guy! Barely any grades so you better get the grade u want on quizzes and the two homework assignments. one mistake and it is hard to come back. nonetheless, he gave out 8 extra credit points which was huge, considering there aren't that many points available

Josh is great. Online lectures were short and to the point. Material is very easy to understand. Exams are easy if you know the material. Only grades were three exams (one of the four exams was dropped) and two very simple assignments. Never met him in person but, Josh seems like a pretty cool guy. Highly recommend this class, easy A.

Professor Bomser is one of the best professor's i've ever had at OSU. Not only does he make the class easy, he also makes it incredibly fun. He has funny lectures, and even tells you not to buy the textbook. He also drops your lowest test grade. He even inspired me to minor in Nutrition. I would 100% recommend taking this class.

The class consists of 4 exams (lowest dropped), and 2 assignments that are very simple. The professor is extremely nice and was very caring during Covid, at the start and end of the lecture he tries to engage students and make sure they know we can contact him at any time. He is very accessible outside of class and has great, simple lectures

wonderful professor. made the class extremely straightforward and was very understanding. made it enjoyable online. lecture provided with lecture slides for class, and they were interesting. 4 exams, lowest one being dropped, and a few assignments. very knowledgeable; this class and the prof pushed me to pick up nutrition minor !!
Easy A even without attending lecture

Great professor, TAKE HIM IF YOU CAN. I took the class online so it was definitely a lot easier than it would've been in person but overall he's amazing. Grades are based mostly on tests though but if you study enough (I studied like one night before the exam but watched all the lectures and took notes) it's an easy A
Professor Bomser is understanding, funny, and usually pretty interesting. Only 4 tests all semester (1 is dropped) and 2 homework assignments. You can skip his lectures and still get an A.

Amazing professor. His notes and lectures are super clear and it's easy to tell what information is important because he repeats it often. He posts all of his recorded lectures online so even if you cannot attend class, it's easy to keep up. Before each class, he clears up any confusion and he really cares about us understanding the material

Easiest class I have ever had. He has every lecture recorded on carmen so you don't have to go to classes. Even if you don't listen to the recorded lectures but just read the slides three times as I did before every exam, you will get very decent grades. I spent only a little bit time on this class but still learned a lot. Take his class!

loved this class! He was a funny dude because of his personality. he basically tells us what is on the exam. take 3/4 exams. one gets dropped. 2 small projects that are easy points. I recommend looking over ur grades. The TA this year deducted points on my projects for no reason so i had to email bomser a couple times to give me points back

Josh is easily the best professor I have had throughout college. I absolutely love him and his course! He makes nutrition super interesting and enjoyable. His course influenced me to minor in nutrition and focus more on fueling my body properly. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND! All lectures are recorded, exams are super easy and he has super simple projects.

this dude is hilarious. I came into class one day seeing him do wall sits. he also OD on purpose off of vitamins during that chapter to show us an example. the exams are easy. most questions are based off the slides. 2 outside projects that are easy A as well. I loved going to class bc of his character. it made the class so fun

Josh is the best prof Ive had so far. He always cares for his students and tries to help them anyway he can. In order to do well on the exams, you need to be able to memorize his study slides. His lectures are also very enjoyable and worth going to.

Easiest class I have ever taken. He posts all his slides on carmen, so you never have to go to class. I study the review slides the night before exam and got As on all the midterms. Only has 3 midterms, 2 super easy projects, and a final (which you most likely dont have to take because the lowest grade is dropped). Such an easy GE.

If you don't show up to this class, you will pass. He's so nice & just wants you to pass. You have 4 exams the entire year & that's it. No homework. Just graded on tests. Your lowest test is dropped. He gives EC if Ohio State wins. I had a D the entire year, he dropped my lowest, it went up. The last exam is just past exam ?'s & some new easy stuff

Josh is an amazing professor. The class consists of 4 exams and 2 SUPER easy projects. He drops your lowest exam grade and as long as you look over the slides before the exams you will do well. It's super straightforward and he posts all the lectures online so you don't HAVE to go to class. I still go though because he's hilarious and really cares
Class is actually enjoyable and you can learn a lot if you attend.

Super funny and chill prof. He also really cares about his students succeeding. He posts his lectures online so I never went to class and just watched the videos. There's 4 exams (he drops the lowest one) and 2 super easy projects. All you really have to do is memorize the slides he posts for exams and it should be an easy A.

While I didn't like how really the only grades were just two projects and four exams, since I felt I had little room for error, I loved this guy. He is a professor who truly cares about the student and since he does lectures online, I was able to watch them when I sprained my ankle and didn't have to walk all the way to South campus. Must have prof

Josh is probably my favorite professor at OSU. If you're looking for an easy and interesting GE- Take HUMNNTR2210. It's an easy A as long as you study and turn in the two mini projects he assigns. He gives 4 tests throughout the semester but drops your lowest grade so I didn't even have to take the final. If you need help, he is very accessible.

If you are looking to get rid of a GE like I was, I HIGHLY recommend this class. There are 5 grades total; 2 small projects and 3 graded tests. However, the projects are easy and the tests are fine too, they're all memory of the notes within the lectures. He posts everything online, though going to class isn't bad at all (you leave early everyday)

Professor Bomser is so sweet and such a great lecturer. This class is straightforward memorizing facts and all his lectures are uploaded on Carmen. I had him for 8AM and attendance isn't mandatory but he is worth waking up for and getting an easy A on the exams. You can tell he loves teaching & definitely wants you to pass. Easy GPA booster class.

Josh is awesome and I would 100% take him again. He says you don't need to go to class and all his lectures are uploaded online. He gives extra credit and there are only two assignments. You get to drop your worst of 3 tests so I didn't need to take the final. He is funny and really cares about his students. TAKE HIM!!!!!

Only went to 2 Lectures and the rest I watched online from the comfort of my bed which was so nice. Best class ever. Your grade is literally midterms plus one homework so make sure you study for them but they are easy if you know the notes. It is an easy A with little to no effort at all. Literally such a move

He is so funny and extremely understanding. He posts every lecture online and attendance isnt taken for a grade. Super chill, super easy to talk to, he loves his job, and makes lectures fun. Doesnt use the textbook at all.

He is the best professor ive ever had. Super funny and the class is really easy, the tests literally take like 15 minutes to complete. He also records all of his lectures so you dont even need to go to class.

Professor Bomser provides one the best classes you could take. He's super funny and really knows his stuff. His lectures are very laid back and he posts videos of them online if you decide not to come to class. You can tell he really wants his students to succeed and understand the material. If you like nutrition and want an easy A, take him!

Josh was an amazing professor to have. He said on day 1 that the book wasn't needed and attendance wasn't mandatory since everything's posted online. Josh was still so great and I went to most of the lectures anyways.

He's amazing! I had Ds on the first 2 exams. After that, he offered to have a study session with my friend and I everyday after class, and I got a B+ on the last 2 exams. He drops your lowest exam grade. He makes the class fun with so much humor added. The class requires memorization, but if someone like me can do it, so can you! I still visit him.
Uploads all lectures online.  Very nice guy and very funny!

Joshua is one of those professors that makes your semester easier. He is super funny and easy going. the lectures are non-mandatory and all of the lectures are online along with audio recordings. he is a blessing! you do have to study for the tests or else you will not pass. but its fairly easy. no textbook required either! take him!

Great guy! I really enjoyed his class. Lectures were recorded using a microphone and put on Carmen, so I would watch the videos in double speed instead of walking across campus in the cold. He prepares you well for the tests, and you are able to drop your lowest test score. The final exam is optional. TAKE THIS CLASS WITH JOSH, FOR SURE! Easy GE

Easily one of the best professors at Ohio State. He was okay with you not going to class because he recorded all of the lectures. I personally liked going to class so that I could see him explaining all of the pictures and mechanisms and then listen to all of the lectures on 2x speed before the exams. He always stays after class to answer questions

One of the best professors I have had. I wish he taught more nutrition courses. He really cares about his students and wants them to learn. Do not hesitate to talk to him about anything! He tries to make his classes easy for you and even posts recorded lectures online. I would definitely recommend!

He is so funny! Gets upset if you don't go to class, but has online lecture which is what I primarily used. His tests are easy as long as you pay attention, so again the online lectures help a lot with that. He really cares, if you go to his office hours you'll def want to continue the convo. Awesome guy, def would take again!

One of my favorite professors at OSU. Really nice guy, and is funny. He really seems to enjoy teaching and cares about his students. He does record the lectures and post them online, which is nice if you're sick one day. I used the online lectures to study for exams and that really helped.

One of the best professors I have had at Ohio State. He made the class relatively easy for the material covered- tests were over the big picture of the topics rather than specific minor details. Also one of the funniest professors, as long as you can understand his sense of humor. Made me want to come to class and participate.

Great class . They werent were lectures as much as they were class disscussions guided by bomser. Very easy going and you can tell he cares. He will go out of his way to find answers to questions students have asked taht he is unsure of. His tests are fair, but be prepared for a lot extended response questions.

One of my favorite professors! Always thanked his students for coming to class and made sure to make lectures as interesting as possible. Definitely have to study for the tests but overall a pretty easy A!

Barely attended class but ended up with an A-. The lecture material provides the majority of the questions on the tests so  really study the lecture notes that are provided online. When I did go to class he was thoroughly interesting to listen to. If my class would not have been a 9 AM I definitely would have made it a point to make it lecture.
Prof Bomser is really nice and funny.  Just wasn't very interested in the class, so it was a little boring.  There is a lot of material to remember, take lots of notes.
Very funny
Bomser's class is easy. His personality keeps people in class more than the material

Dr. Bomser is super nice, and always helpful. His tests are very fair and if you study for the exams you will get an A. You do not need the textbook but if you're really interested in the material it will give you a bunch of extra neat info.
I enjoyed going to this class  only because he is so cute. Other than that his lectures were hard to follow

Dr. Bomser is not a good adviser or mentor and would not recommend students join his lab.   His pedestrian approach to science has meant that not one former student in ten years has pursued a post-doc or has a lab.  He does not train students to be independent researchers.

Dr. Bomser is an an excellent writer, scientist, and mentor as well as possessing original scientific ideas and hypotheses. He's single-handedly discovered the healing power of green tea, white tea, black tea, red tea, oolong tea, blue tea, rose tea, and, of course, chocolate tea.  His guidance in the laboratory is unparalleled and a tour de force

Favorite class so far.  He's really funny, very interesting, the quizzes were a joke, but I learned a lot.  Never used the textbook, I'd always went to class because I liked it, but you could get away with skipping it no problem. You get to drop a quiz and exam grade, so he grades easy too. Really good class
really easy just make sure to do all of the assignments accurately. Coming to class is not mandatory but helps as he sometimes gives out test questions in lecture

Tests were really easy and straight forward. If you go to class, he usually tells you some questions that will appear on the tests so attendance definately improves your grade. He is so witty and makes the class really enjoyable and relates it to his own life and also to students. Great teacher, would totally recommend him and the class!

I don't know what anyone is talking about when they say he is easy! All of the lectures are on Carmen but his exams are impossible, the usual average was somewhere in the high D to low C range. Stay away from him! He makes class interesting but is an impossible grader!
amazing-easiest class i've ever taken and you don't need to go to class because lectures are online. never bought the book either. definitely recommended
great teacher, very interested in teaching the class.  class lectures posted online as long as attendence is not too bad.  easy class, fair grades, great teacher.

Joshua Bomser has made be believe that there are still some good professors out there.. He is fair, straight-forward, and generally willing to help any student. He is quick at responding to questions whether it be through e-mail or through the online dicussions.. Simply put Joshua Bomser is the best professer I have taken ever..Take him.

His class is very interesting, and gives you alot of info. on how your body works with food. The grading is awesome, but to warn you that his assignments are easy but EXTREMELY TOUGH GRADING SO LOOKOUT!!!! I would just take the online course, because you don't have to go to class and it's a GEC.
I definately recommend taking this class, the tests and assignments are really easy. He posts all his notes online and usually gives test Q's in class.
Josh is a good prof that enjoys teaching and being with college students.  I wasn't the most interested in HumNut when I started but he made class interesting and fun... Grade A-

Definitely a prof I recommend.  Grading was extremely fair, tests were easy if you come to class or spend some time looking over it.  He was so easy to understand and spoke clearly.  5 exams, but he only counts 4.  so the 5th is optional.  assignments are so easy!  It's hard not to do well on them.  Plus he usually curves the class at the end.

H.S. level assignments, pretty easy tests.  Lectures are pretty dull.  He eventually decided to post them to webCT as long as class attendence stayed high.  Gives 5 tests but only takes 4 grades, so if you screw one up you get another chance.  Optional final if your happy with what you have.

Ok this guy seems real cool and his lectures arent that bad.  but he wont post all of his lectures making it hard to study and he half of his midterms are trick questions that screw you up.  other than that he's ok
Really Nice guy. Test are pretty high school level. Cares enough to help ya out if your confused but with this class, theres no reason to be. Id def. suggest him!

summary_comment: Professor Maxwell's teaching style varies widely based on student feedback. Some find her classes overwhelming, with excessive video content and resources, while others appreciate her availability and willingness to help, especially during difficult exams. The workload is generally heavy, focusing on memorization and frequent assignments, but success is achievable with consistent effort and engagement.

Ratings.comment: Do not take 5650 from Kathryn. There are tests every two weeks that only have 30 questions but have taken me more than 3 hours to complete. All of the questions are select-all that apply and are impossible to answer. She doesn't lecture she just has group discussions for every class that you listen to her talk about random things for 2 hours.

She gives open-note exams but they are impossible because the answers you need are nowhere to be found in her notes. She decided instead of lecturing every class would be a discussion but she does all the talking and covers nothing on the tests. There's a paper due every couple of weeks which is the only way to keep your grade up with her exams.

This is the third class that I have taken with prof maxwell and it wasn't by choice. There is so much work its impossible to keep up with. She posts ~5 hours of videos each week and so many resources its impossible to look at all of them. But, her classes are fairy easy to get a good grade in if you can just focus on the busy work and use Quizlet.
Kathryn's class was fairly easy. MEMORIZATION! assignments are given weekly, you never meet or hear from the professor. It is just constant assignments, quizzes, and exams.

Professor was good. I had very minimal interaction, being that it was an asynchronous class. But, her lectures were helpful. All of the points come from case concept quizzes, chapter assessments, and exams. Luckily everything is open note.

She bombards you with so much information, you have no idea what to study or even takeaway from her "lectures". She expects way too much from her students for a 3 credit hour online course. Her activities in the lecture require digging through links and lectures just to find that her answers don't connect to anything. Only had her a few weeks.

Absolutely bombed my exam, but Prof Maxwell was happy to meet with me to discuss what I did wrong. She took 1.5 hrs out of her day to call me and to show me study strategies that I think will actually work, and I know she has so many other things to do/classes to teach. While her tests are extremely hard, she is willing to help you.

Professor Maxwell is very knowledgable and understanding. This is my second class with her. Communicate with her and she will help. It is easy to succeed in her classes if you do the assigned work and follow through with studying. Pathophysio is not a super easy class to begin with, but professor Maxwell makes it manageable.

Do the homework and DO the excel file she suggest you to memorize what is needed. Follow up after the exam what you did wrong and she will help. Online the homework + cases are important. She gives you a method to learn, follow it and success is granted! I'm not good memorizer but homework, pronounce exercise help! clear classes + what is required

She gives out a lot of homework but they were always easy. Her exams are harder than the homeworks but if you put a lot of time towards studying you'll be fine. We had some group projects that we periodically had to zoom for in small groups which seemed unnecessary, but overall not bad.

While she seems like a nice teacher, be prepared to do a lot of busy work. Her exams do not correlate to her lecture materials at all. She will make you do lots of extra work with no true benefit to understanding the class.

Honestly the worst online class I have ever taken. Lectures dont correlate to quizzes or exams at all. And way too much material to go throw. Lectures are basically just long paper articles to go throw. Vet hard to follow. Textbook is required and helps some, but still a lot of tested information cant be found.  Harder grader also!!

She gave me mercy when i thought an exam was on another day, and I had missed it. I have had her for 2 full semesters and have done well, so it's possible. You have to read and study. Material is at your fingertips, you just have to apply yourself. She gives you her cell number too if you need her. She's great.

Unfotuntatly there seems to be a pattern here. This is one of the worst classes I have ever taken. Exams do not match lectures, no communication, and assignments are regraded with no reasoning. Quizzes incorrect. So far approx 30% of exam material posted <48 hours before exam for the 2nd time. Take an in-class version, instead of this instructor

This is one of those online classes where you should be prepared to teach yourself all of the material. The tests are 2.5 hours long and the content is very dry. The class is do-able but the notes provided by the instructor won't help much.

SHE IS NEARLY IMPOSSIBLE TO REACH BY EMAIL, CALLING HER CELLPHONE IS THE BEST BET. SHE IS INCREDIBLY SLOW AT GRADING PROJECTS. ALL OF HER EXAMS WERE ONLINE, OPEN FOR 72 HOURS AND COMPLETELY OPEN NOTE. SHE IS A VERY NICE PERSON AND IS INCREDIBLY INTELLIGENT. THE LECTURES, HOWEVER, WERE VERY LONG AND BORING MOST OF THE TIME.

Professor Maxwell's class was pretty easy. A lot of work, but manageable for 3 credit hours. I spent 3-5 hours on class each week. There are 15 chapters w/ about 150 words each. Homework is very repetitious, but that makes it easy to get good grades when each chapter has the same format. Maxwell was accessible in person & via her personal phone #.

Kathryn makes this interesting class horrible. Notes are not organized well. She uploaded the text book partially and you wont know where exams will be. Heavy and detailed Quizzes and case studies weekly each. Exams are 2hr30min long per two weeks. My overall suggestion-do NOT take this class unless you have to.

From day one, this professor was amazing. She offered students the chance to meet her in person, and my friend and I took it. Not many online profs are as considerate of their students' grades as Kathryn was; she gave us the best possible tips and tricks for a better grade. They all worked and I was very very satisfied. I loved the topic (med term)

She's well organized, fair and a great professor. I've taken 3 of her classes: 2500, 5500, and 5370 with her and she consistently makes me eager to attend class or work on her class ahead of time instead of procrastinating.

Pathophysiology is significantly more difficult than medical terminology with Maxwell, so just keep that in mind. Most tests are 75 questions and timed. You get 2 and a half hours to complete them. It takes the entire time and there is one 5 hour slot in the week when it is opened. Super inconvenient.
Make the spreadsheets and you will pass this course. All online, including the midterms and final. Never interacted with Kathryn but her class was an easy A and I learned from it as well

She is rude in her comments towards you and has trouble trying to empathize with you in any way. Some homework questions are vague and subjective so it is almost impossible to get all the points for every assignment. On the positive side, she does respond relatively promptly and the content would not be too difficult if it was taught by a good prof

You basically have 1 week per chapter, 5 graded assignments per chapter. Lots of opportunities for points but it's so much work for a 3 credit class. Everything, even the exams, are online. Exams are every 3 weeks. She does give her cell number in case of an emergency during an exam.  You definitely have to work for your grade.

Such an easy class! If you do the assignments and pay attention to what you're doing, you'll be fine. I never read the material. When you fill in the excel sheets, add an extra column for the pronunciation. This makes it easier when doing any other assignments. Just put in a few hours a week!!

Patho. SO MUCH WORK. Constant quizzes, assignments, and exam almost every other week. If you keep up with the material and stay organized, its not too bad. Be prepared to teach yourself the information. the questions are pretty straightforward; you either know it or you dont.

This class is a lot of work and a lot of things to memorize. Make quizlets for each section and use that to help you with the tests. Don't take the homework for granted. Every point counts. Prof Maxwell will help you anytime you need help. Participate in discussions too because she's a lot more likely to round your grade up if you do.

You'll learn TONS of new words, but Kathryn goes the extra mile to give students every opportunity to be successful in this course. She offers optional lectures and even lists her cell number in case of wifi emergencies during exams. Everything's online so there's no reason to not get an AB with minimal effort. A pretty straightforward class.

Class is online. Slow and unprofessional in responding to student emails.  Mistakes and discrepancies between book and powerpoints.  In person lectures are optional, but completely pointless.  Class is pretty easy, but you learn absolutely nothing.
This is an online class! Super easy and does not take up a lot of time! Definitely take this course if you need a GPA booster.

opportunity for a lot of points (quizzes, assignments, 5 exams) and gives you 3 weeks in between exams. I usually saved all the work a week before each exam and still  got an A. She also offers an optional lecture once a week, and replies to e-mails promptly.

Maxwell was one of the most unorganized professors I've ever had at OSU. The date of an exam was changed 3 times the week we were supposed to take it.. The notes she supplies to complete the concept assessments were not helpful. The textbook will be your best friend. I could not tell you three things I learned from this course this semester....

Best tip: NOTE CARDS! The course is all online now and is pretty time consuming but everything except for the exams (which are about every 3 weeks, 5 exams total) are open book & open note. Your grade is not dependent on your exams, a lot of points each week on online quizzes, 5 per chapter, 1 chapter a week.

Be ready to teach yourself the material - I've been a medical professional for 10+ years and meeting with her in person left me more confused than before I met with her. Don't expect a prompt response from her and be ready for your questions to be answered by, "Carefully review the definitions in the text" or other go back to the book answers.
Required Pre-Req. Not too terribly difficult but lots of memorization and mind numbing repetition.

THIS CLASS IS NOW ALL ONLINE.. takes up so much of your time... i recommend stocking up on 1000 of notecards because i use just about 200 every other week! 4 quizzes for each chapter online.. tests are really easy so as long as you know the terms you are set because the tests are very very reasonable for all the info you have to learn.

Incredibly boring three hour lectures. Have to go though and stay cuz she takes attendance at the end of class. Bring other work or make notecards (Very helpful) to pass the time cuz she reads straight from the book and you don't have to pay attention. Easy A but lots of work for a 3 credit class

probably the most boring teacher on campus. lecture is 3 hours long, but attendance is necessary because you get credit for going. she reads straight from the textbook. if you can take this class online, DO IT.

The material is very, but you only have 2 weeks to memorize each set of 3 chapters worth of medical terms. This class will definitely take up ALL your time. WAY too much work for a 3-credit class. Overall- good teacher, fair grading, online final, but VERY time consuming. attendance counts for 50pts, and an A is a 95 instead of a 93
Very easy class, but lecture can be mind-numbing.

Has set up the class to help you get an A (even for those not used to good grades).  Genuinely interested in helping students learn.  Show up to lectures, do online quizes, study an hour or two for the tests (150 plus terms per test) and get an easy A.  I would take her again if she ever offered another course I wanted.
All the material was very straightforward. She is a very nice lady, but the lectures were boring.  However, the class was only one night a week, so it wasn't bad.
She's so boring!  Her classes are always easy A's, but you have to go to class.  I just wish she wouldn't teach so many classes.  You will never use your book!

so basically there is a 3 hr. lecture every other week w/ easy exams on the off weeks which take you less than an hour then you leave. the exams are mult. choice w/3 possible answers. In lecture- don't need to pay attention just make a sheet with the terms from the first page of the ch., study it & you'll have nothing lower than a a-(i would hope)

Not a hard class by any means, but so incredibly boring it's hard to keep focus. I made flash cards and did other homework during every lecture. It's nice to get out early on exam days. She's a nice chick, but not much of a teacher.
This class was very easy, but it was one of the most boring lectures I've ever been to. plus it was three hours long, and she took attendace after reading from the book the whole time.

The class was extremely easy. Unfortunately, she takes attendance at the end of a 3-hour lecture in order to keep everyone there. Tests don't take very long, because there are only 3 choices for 100 multiple-choice questions. No one should get below an A in this class.

summary_comment: The professor is consistently described as ineffective and unhelpful, making the class feel like a punishment rather than a learning experience. Students found the workload heavy and the grading process unfair and delayed, while the professor's lack of knowledge and poor attitude further detracted from the class. Overall, the feedback is overwhelmingly negative, with many students advising against taking the class.

Ratings.comment: This prof is horrible.  She is not helpful and actually added more points to the already 1000 point class. An online class is supposed to be convenient and it felt more like punishment. She made exam timeframes instead of opening it up for a day and NEVER got back to you or the class in a timely manner.  She is miserable and unhappy and makes you know it.
This class had the chance to be fun but instead she talked about how hard her life was. She also had no clue what she was talking about. It is an easy A but not worth it. So boring!!!

Awful professor. Doesn't know anything about the subject matter outside of the PowerPoint slides. Also told us not to purchase text book and said all exam questions would be on slides, but there were plenty of exam questions from the book (a book we didn't have access to because the library didn't put it on reserve). Overall just a poor prof.
For a 3 hour class, there were 5 papers and 2 online exams which the class averaged about a 70%.  Did not grade the papers til the last day of the quarter.  Tough grader.  Not clear.  Very unhelpful.
One of the worst instructors I have ever had... Don't take this class it is a waste of time.

Trivial information with a prof that only talks about herself. She talks about her pregnancy more than the class material. There are 6 papers in this class which she takes about 5 weeks per paper to grade. Going into finals week you will still be waiting for 5 papers to be graded. She is useless as an instructor and has no business in the classroom

This class was Sexuality and Health and had the potential to be very fun and interesting but she RUINED IT. She is a horrible teacher! She taught straight from the book and didnt know ANYTHING that wasnt in the book. If we asked her a question, 9 times out of 10 she had to look up the answer herself! She also had a horrible attitude.
She is HORRIBLE!! that's all there is to it!

summary_comment: This professor is widely regarded as ineffective, with students strongly advising against her in-person classes. She fails to provide clear explanations and does not engage with questions, instead reading directly from PowerPoint slides without additional context or clarification.

Ratings.comment: DON'T TAKE HER. TAKE THE CLASS ONLINE. SHE SUCKS AND DOESN'T EXPLAIN ANYTHING. FORGET ABOUT ASKING ANY QUESTIONS, SHE WON'T ANSWER THEM. READS TOTALLY OFF POWER POINT WITH LITTLE OR NO EXPLANATION.

summary_comment: Dr. DiSilvestro is highly regarded for making complex material engaging and easy to understand, though some students note his powerpoint slides are best understood in context of in-class lectures. Students consistently recommend attending class and studying diligently for an easy A, praising his clear teaching style and willingness to help students succeed. Overall, he is seen as a knowledgeable and approachable professor who genuinely cares about his students' understanding of the subject matter.

Ratings.comment: He made the material so interesting and is so passionate about the material that you have to love him. You definitely have to study for this class, but it is an easy A if you attend lecture and study ahead of time.

Easy to get an A if you show up to class and take notes. His powerpoints are made up entirely of fragmented sentences, which is why you shouldn't skip class because you won't make any sense of them. He does offer extra credit quizzes after exams if you didn't do so hot. Gives a biography throughout the course of his athletic career and success.

I really enjoyed this class. Though the few interactions I had with him he was rude and had an inflated ego, he still gives good lectures and doesn't make his class too difficult for a GE. Would recommend this course overall.

Dr. DiSilvestro was amazing. Lecture heavy, but puts the slides online, attendance isn't mandatory, but is highly recommended, because the textbook isn't mandatory and the test and quiz questions are only form lecture. Also make sure you attend the Exam Reviews, and you'll for sure get an A.

Dr. D is a fantastic professor and person. He makes clear all semester that he does not want to make the class too hard for us but instead just wants us to learn the material. Quizzes and exams are extremely easy, study the night before and you'll be fine. He loves talking about his businesses in lecture and really tries to learn everyone's names.

If you have the chance to take Human Nutrition 2210-- do it! Professor DiSilvestro understands that this is a GE for some people and does everything he can to help students get a good grade. Come to class, take notes, study and you will be fine. Professor DiSilvestro truly knows what he is talking about and knows a lot about nutrition.

Dr. D is a hilarious guy! He likes to tell stories but I don't mind it. You have to go to class to learn the info that will be on quizzes and exams, but attendance isn't technically mandatory. Quizzes are super easy and exams are pretty easy if you study a little. There is one "assignment"/project in this class but it isn't hard.

Fun class, pretty easy if you put in the work. Quizzes require basic preparation. Slides are posted, but you wont understand unless you go and take detailed notes. 3 non-cumulative exams, easy assignment with extra credit opportunity. Lots of extra credit after each exam. Good Science course. Good professor, nice, wants you to do well.

Attendance isn't technically mandatory, and he does put the slides on Carmen, but you get more info from the actual lectures. He tells lots of little stories, which I personally find helpful because they break up the information and make certain things easier to remember. Not a difficult class, but it really does help if you actually show up.

This professor cannot be bothered to even write coherent sentences on his slides. His slides are filled with grammatical errors and question marks. He loves to tell unfunny stories, and goes on a ridiculous amount of tangents. He advised us not to buy the textbook, but questions on his quizzes/tests are sometimes not on the slides.

He posts the slides after class so attendance isn't mandatory. A few quizzes which were pretty easy, lowest dropped. Overall, not much work. He laughs at his own jokes and loves to tell stories about his college volleyball days, he's pretty funny.

This professor is one of my favorites. You can tell he loves what he does and makes sure that his students come first. His lectures are very interesting and he throws in some humor. 10/10 recommend taking this class with DiSilvestro if you get the chance.

This class is an easy A. There is a ton of extra credit and the tests are simply multiple choice. You don't need to buy the textbook, just show up to class and study the slides and you'll get an A. The professor is caring, likes to tell stories, and he wants you to pass.

Dr. DiSilvestro was the goofiest professor I have ever met. He was insanely easy and as long as you look at the slides online and do the old practice exam the night before each test you'll get an A or B. When he isn't teaching he's either bragging about his business or how he played volleyball in grad school. Easy class for a science credit.
Nice guy, relaxed lectures, super easy exams. Lecture slides are posted online, making getting an A easy even if you don't go to class

Class is lecture heavy as a textbook is not required, but he puts slides on Carmen for every class. He's super sweet and tries to get to know everyone in the huge lecture. Quizzes are easy -- can pick and choose what questions to answer. Gets off track a lot with funny stories about his work and family, but they make lecture easier to sit through

If you study the night before and right before a quiz or exam you'll do fine. He makes the class super easy and I recommend this class for anyone who's taking harder classes and wants at least an easy A. Plus he tells funny stories throughout the course.
Always willing to help after class although during lectures he tends to get sidetracked by telling stories that barely relate to lecture which can be a waste of time but still funny.

Dr. DiSilvestro's anecdotes made him appear very approachable and made class fun.  I appreciated that his quizzes allowed for a little wiggle room; we were able to pick and choose which questions we wanted to answer. His tests, I thought, were written very well.
Very easy class. DiSilvestro is dedicated to his work and is a good instructor. Study for quizzes and exams the night before and you'll be fine

He really knows what his stuff! Little to no use of textbook. Going to class isn't mandatory but if you don't go, you'll miss all the test information. All of his test material is based off of lecture. His humor can get a little much at times, but I'd much rather have that than a boring prof! Highly recommended!
Dr. D may is certainly one of my favorite professors.  He makes the class interesting and as long as you know the information on the in-class slides you will get an A.
Beware robert doesn't teach 210. His son David does. David is not as good or as organized.
Loved him! Super funny, and very helpful. I really enjoyed this class and would recommend!

Awesome professor!! He really knows what he's talking about.8 quizzes-drops the lowest 2 and every quiz has extra credit and that's what the book is used for. Go to class because he will tell you stuff that's not in the book at all that you need to know.
Good professor, thinks he's funny. No need for the book unless you want the bonus questions on quiz.

Class was an easy A plus you get to learn some interesting things. You only need the book for the bonus questions on the quizzes. He doesn't post notes so you have to go to class and this will result in your email filling up with annoying people sending out mass emails asking for the notes. Definitely take it if he is teaching.
Really easy class. Study an hour before the exams, do the assignment early to get the extra credit and you'll get an A.

This class was cake. I took it just so I could balance my upper level science courses because I heard it was extremely easy...and it was. I probably studied around half an hour for the exams and I started the assignment the day it was due and managed an A w/ no problem. Book not necessary, but go to lecture since he practically takes ?s from notes.

Fun Class! But he is not very helpful after class, during office hours. I visited him twice about lectures, and was very unfriendly, and even worse of very little help. First Exam is very tough, but the last two are very straight foward. Useful class

Dr. D was a great prof. Class was very straightforward and material was relevant and interesting. Weekly quizzes were easy. Do not need to buy the book to succeed in the class: bonus book question on quiz is easy and takes common sense more than anything. Tests were easy as well...study the study guide! Great GEC to cover Science Requirement!

Ditto on what everyone else said. He is hilarious..I actually looked forward to going to class, and I had it at 8:30 in the morning. If you're lookin for a science GEC and you're not a science person-take this class. Its easy, but you learn stuff that you can use in your day to day life too!

Easiest class I have ever had. I would literally study for an hour for every exam and get an A. Quizes are super easy and so are bonus questions. You should consider dropping out of college if you fail this class.

Dr. Disilvestro is awesome! VERY easy class...keeps notes in his office so you can go copy them down if you don't want to go to class. You take the best 5/8 quizes..and easy bonus questions on them. Exams are EASY. Rarely went to class and got an A...but always got the notes from his office. He's hilarious and probably the best prof i've had at osu

This was one of my favorite classes! The information is interesting and practical. It definitely applies to everyday life. Plus, Dr. D is funny & really helpful during office hours. Go to class & take notes, and you'll do fine! Quizzes, exams, and project are straightforward and relatively simple. I highly recommend this class!
Very entertaining and informative.  There is no way anyone can fail this class if they show up. He harldy uses the book and when he does he tells you the pages he will test from.

Great class and great prof!  Class can be boring at 9am, but it's worth it bc dr. d tells you everything that will be on the quizzes/exams.  final assignment is easy and if you turn it in early you can get up to like 8 extra credit points.
Dr. D was awesome! I would recommend taking him! He is entertaining to say the least.

Looking past my difficulty dealing with his raspy voice at 9 in the morning, DiSilvestro is one of the best professors that I have had.  The info. covered is extremely interesting and important for anyone to know and he makes it fun with stories and comics.  Do not buy the book, it is not necessary.  Easy exams/quizzes.  All around great professor!

What an awesome prof. really knows what he's talking about and gives a lot of practical information. also, he understands that 210 is a typical GEC class and doesn't act like you have no other classes than his like some profs. also, he's hilarious. good guy. anyone would like him

The Best Prof.I had at OSU. Very helpful during office hrs. Keeps lectures entertaining with his hilarious tangents. A very entertaining course yet I still learned a lot from this professor. Definitely take DiSilvestro for this class.
cool guy. funny, real random at times but keeps on topic. lots of extra credit too.

One of the greatest professors I've ever had.  Basically the last two posters were on the money, except I would highly advise going to class, I think when you copy the overheads, they don't make a whole lot of sense...Do the project early, it took me a half hour and kicked myself for waiting til the last minute.

Quizes: Read class notes and book (small parts) and you'll do fine. Tests: Dito. Pros: He offers extra credit on quizes and project, he's funny!, he knows his material. Cons: He touches his nose, pants, and self A LOT during lectures, which can be distracting and weird. Summary: TAKE HIM ALREADY, what are you waiting for?

This guy is great.  Everything a GEC is supposed to be somewhat interesting and an easy class.  You don't even have to go to class if your willing to go to his office hours and copy the notes.  Quizes and Tests are not hard.  Project is gimme points.  TURN IT IN EARLY AND GET THE EXTRA CREDIT POINTS.
Easy but your need to go to friday lectures! Funny stories actually help you remember!
Good teacher, throws in some humor. If you go to class you should do well. He was thinking about leaving but is probably coming back so take the opportunity to take this class
funny man. good class. easy. GO TO FRIDAY LECTURES! :)  take this class if it's an option!

LOVED this class! Disilvestro is by far, one of the best professors that I have had at Ohio State. He made class interesting and funny- with jokes. Tests and quizes are not hard if you study the material given. Going to class helps- because he gives you hints to remember things! Take this class and get Dilsilvestro as your prof!
No Comments

If you're taking notes, use his slides as a key word reference, because what he puts up is usually loosly connected thoughts that guide him through the lecture. I think he really needs these the most because he gets way too ADHD to stay on topic. not that that is a bad thing because it's usually entertaining. That being said, he's a good professor.

Umm don't think because he puts up notes on the overhead that you'll understand them to study for quizzes and tests. My mistake for the first week or so. If you take good notes, take advantage of his extra credit oppurtunities (like with the nutrition analysis assigned), and study a bit, you shouldn't need to read even for the quizzes, to get an A.

He is a nice guy but also a braggart.  He loves to talk about himself and how much of an expert he is in the field.  He tells a lot of stories which are nothing to do with the class.  They may be entertaining IF I hadn't already worked all day.  The content itself is not that difficult.  He does give extra credit and bonuses.
by far the best teaching ive had.  the guy is a genius.  a real nice guy, pretty entertaining. class was never boring. highly recommend him ill look to schedule classes with him in the future
The professor is awesome. and the fact that the class is esay is only because the professor is so nice and give us tons of extra credit. absolute the best.Go class, study, should get A

Really easy class if you just go and take notes. He has an annoying voice, and often talks waaay to much when he could just present the notes in a straight-forward manner. Overall, he is a nice guy and the class is super easy

First off, this class is really easy if you just go to class and study the notes. Second, Disilvestro is a really nice guy. He's not only a good teacher and very clear about the material, but he is really funny. His tangents are classic.
Good class & teacher, take this is your second bio course!
He was great. Go to class and you will get an A
Dr. D is my favorite professor I've had so far at OSU..he's a NUT!  definitely hilarious yet teaches well..not to mention the class is very interesting..I would definitely recommend taking this class
Probably the best prof. ive had yet. A surprisingly interesting and easy(if u get/take notes) class that i recommend to anyone needing a bio class
Great teacher. Don't miss the class, take notes, and you'll get good grade. Don't really have to read the textbook. Give hints on the exams and quizes. The class is interesting.
Easy to follow. Makes a boring subject interesting and fun!

Dr. D was a great teacher.  You have to go to every lecture or you will miss exam questions.  He is very clear, but does like to go off on tangents.  Most of his stories have a point, but some are just funny.  I enjoyed this class more than any other.
very helpful, very very smart guy, and he adds humour to his class. I highly recommend this guy! He's an A++++ teacher!
Really easy! Mostly memorizing functions of vitamins and weight loss plans. Fun class!

Easy class! The teacher is fun and adds humor to his teaching. He's very very smart and has done tons of research and publications. The test come straight from the notes. I highly recommend the class! Dr. D is awesome!
Nice guy.  Slightly unorganized, but tells you almost exactly what to expect on the exam.
Dr. D was one of my favorite teachers! He's great!
No Comments
Dr. D is a great Prof.
I loved this guy, for human nutrion 210... he does go off on alot of tangents but it keeps the class interesting... i would definitely recomend taking him for this class it is extremely easy
This guy goes off on so many tangents you start to wonder what actually counts as course material.
Really nice guy..very useful class..would be very easy if he was slightly more organized
